preqs: Students must have completed one of the following units: BFB1001, BFC1001, BFF1001, BFP1001 or BFW1001 PLUS one of the following units: BFB2140, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFP2140 or BFW2140

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {BFB1001, BFC1001, BFF1001, BFP1001} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Must be enrolled in course type {09-4, 10, 41, 50}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFC3340, AFF3751, BFC3340, BFF3751}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFC3340, AFF3751, BFC3340, BFF3751}
Must be enrolled in course type {09-4, 10, 41, 50}

(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {BFB1001, BFC1001, BFC2000, BFF1001, BFP1001} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {BFB2140, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFP2140, BFW2140} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})

description: This unit examines the institutional features of futures and options markets, the use of futures, options and other derivatives in arbitraging, trading and hedging, and prices of these instruments.
